name: dewatering of ethanol from biomass, from 95% to 99.7% solution state | ethanol, without water, in 99.7% solution state, from fermentation | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4468/documentation

Inventory refers to the production of 1 kg anhydrous ethanol 99.7% (dry basis, i.e. 1.003 kg anhydrous ethanol wet basis). Dehydration is carried out by molecular sieve technology. Ethanol is produced from corn, in the average US context.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



This dataset includes the dehydration of hydrated ethanol (95%) to anhydrous ethanol (99.7%). Hydrated ethanol input is corn-based ethanol, produced in the US context. Treatment of waste streams is included.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data from 1990 to 2006, current dry-mill technology for the production of ethanol from corn
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data is from the etha+ project (Alcosuisse, CH), adapted to US context
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Dehydration is done by molecular sieve technology.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data is from the etha+ project (Alcosuisse, CH), technology by French ethanol plant supplier, modelling by ENERS (CH)
